v0.9.0 alpha build 1
v0.9.0 alpha build 2
v0.9.0 alpha build 3
v0.9.0 alpha build 4
v0.9.0 alpha build 5
v0.9.0 alpha build 6
v0.9.0 alpha build 7
v0.9.0 alpha build 8
v0.9.0 alpha build 9
v0.9.0 alpha build 10
v0.9.0 alpha build 11
v0.9.0 alpha build 12
Notes and references
This is a list of Pocket Edition v0.9.0 alpha development versions.
v0.9.0 alpha build 1 is the first build version released for v0.9.0 alpha, and the first build version released in 2014.

Added immersive mode for Android.
Only Android 4.4 KitKat.
Available on other versions with 3rd party-apps.

Superflat world type.
Updated create world screen - now includes Superflat, Infinite and 'old' world types.
Unlimited worlds.
New falling mechanics for sand and gravel.
New insta ticking of water and lava.
Grass and foliage colors for different biomes.
Water color for swamps.
Added more spawn eggs in creative.
New interact button (to make the game easier for new players).

Boulders.
Ice patches.
Ice spikes.
Lakes.
Double plants.
Tall Grass.
Trees:
Jungle trees (small and large)
Mega Jungle trees
Mega Spruce trees
Acacia trees.
Version exclusive Fallen trees.
Version exclusive Oak trees (swamp and large oak variants).
Huge mushroom.
Mossy cobblestone boulder.
Lilypads.
Vines.
Melons.
Pumpkins.
Dead bushes.
Dungeons.
Desert wells.
Fallen logs and stumps.
Emerald ore.
Caves.
Lava at the bottom of caves
Caves in desert and mesa
Strongholds.
Villages
Abandoned mine shafts.

Extreme hills.
Redwood taiga.
Roofed forests.
Jungle.
Savannah.
Mesa.
Mushroom island.
Deep ocean.
Swamps.

Podzol.
Mycelium.
Huge mushroom blocks.
Cocoa.
End portal frames.
Double plants.
Dark Oak and Acacia Wood
With their Stairs, Slabs, Planks, and Leaves variants.
Saplings:
Jungle saplings,
Acacia saplings,
Dark Oak spalings.
Stained clay (In all its 16 colors).
Lilypad.
12 new Flowers:
Blue Orchids
Alliums
Azure Bluets
Tulips (red, orange, white, pink)
Oxeye Daisies
Sunflowers
Lilacs
Rose Bushes
Peonies.
Red sand.
Hardened clay.
End stone.
Granite
With it's polished variant.
Diorite
With it's polished variant.
Andesite
With it's polished variant.
Emerald block
Emerald Ore.
Packed Ice.
Version exclusive: Grassless Dirt.

6 Spawn eggs:
Slimes
Endermen
Mooshroom
Wolf
Silverfish
Zombie Pigman.
Emeralds.
Slimeballs.

Slimes.
Endermen.
Wolves.
Mooshrooms.
Silverfish.
Villagers
Baby villagers.

The version watermark visible in development versions has been moved from the bottom of the screen to the top.
Prettier clouds
New culling of clouds.
The fog is darker underground.
Textures
New leaves rendering.
Inventory/GUI
New crafting screen.
Stonecutter UI Changed.

Removed generated structures:
Oceans
Added as a biome instead
Gravel beaches
Frozen Oceans
Will no longer naturally generate

Removed biomes:
Shrubland
Seasonal forest
Rainforest
Tundra

Correct name for stairs, slabs and spawn eggs.
Beds no longer give full health in normal difficulty.
Smooth lighting added for:
Beds
Fences
Walls
Cobweb
Chests
Leaves
Smooth lighting removed for:
Glowstone
Glass
Jack 'o' lanterns
Improved performance of TNT.

"New" mob spawning.
Passive mobs now spawn naturally in creative mode without the use of spawn eggs.

Spiders.
Now spawn from leaves, creating a higher amount of spiders in tree-rich biomes at night.
Animation is now twice as fast.
Improved AI.
Zombies.
Zombie AI and mechanics changed, made much more horde-like.

New culling algorithm.[1][2]
Tile entities are saved differently.
New leveldb based saving format.
New entity handling.
Updated light generation.
Remade network code (mostly the same packages but new system).

10 issues fixed
From released versions before 0.9.0

MCPE-1134 – No sharing/broadcast session on LAN for 2nd generation Kindle Fire.
MCPE-1796 – Sleeping in Bed Resets Health
MCPE-6185 – mushrooms dont glow
MCPE-6589 – Typo
MCPE-6865 – Inconsistent protocol data types usage
MCPE-7091 – CompoundTag::putLong has wrong parameter type (should be long long, not long)
MCPE-7169 – Can't Delete world

MCPE-7354 – There is no Villager Spawn Egg
MCPE-7463 – Torches
MCPE-7509 – No villager spawn egg in creative
v0.9.0 alpha build 2 is the second build version released for v0.9.0 alpha.
Added sounds to all new mobs (villagers, slimes, wolves, endermen).

Creative inventory
Monster Spawner
The type of mob spawner can be changed using a spawn egg.
Villager spawn egg
Endermen now teleport out of the way of arrows.

Worlds no longer get stuck during loading.
Fixed a subtle crash and world corruption.
Fixed a possible crash on quit.
Removed the gray quad on split controls.
Crops don't flicker anymore while walking.
Added name to podzol.
Desert villages are now made of sandstone.
Fire dies out faster in jungle and roofed forest to prevent runaway fires.
Fixed black borders in flat worlds on chunk.
Red sand doesn't transform anymore in normal sand when falling.
Mobs aren't blue anymore when render distance 64 is selected.
Glowstone and snow layers no longer randomly rotate the textures of certain surrounding blocks.
Mushrooms don't glow anymore.
Diorite, granite and andesite now drop the correct resource type.
Dark oak, acacia leaves, and trunks now catch fire.
You can now place torches on mob spawners.
Mob spawners are saved now.
v0.9.0 alpha build 3 is the third build version released for v0.9.0 alpha.

Lily pads are now brighter in the inventory
Sheep now eat tall grass
No more village skyscrapers
Added dye recipes for all flowers
The low memory render distance now has an additional tick

Zombies not targeting players
Crash when generating lava
Lava lighting
Water intersecting by caves would be stuck in air
Spiders would instantly attack when you hit them
Savanna and dark oak could be crafted into each other's planks
Top of doors not opening and closing
Potential crash when placing blocks at y 127
Enderman should now have sounds
Emerald blocks were put into decorations
The smooth stone variants now require the correct stone type
Top snow is now destroyed when the block underneath is destroyed
Granite, diorite and andesite drops again
v0.9.0 alpha build 4 is the fourth build version released for v0.9.0.

The animation for spiders is now twice as fast
End portal frames' texture changed from the Java Edition Beta 1.9 Prerelease 3 texture to the current Java Edition Beta 1.9 Prerelease 4 texture.
The swamp biome's look has changed from the Java Edition Beta 1.8 look to its current Beta 1.9 Prerelease look.

"Saving" bug has been fixed
Fixed item in hand bug
Fixed shadow of entities
Fixed trap doors and smooth shading
Fixed rendering issues with lily pads
Sand will no longer fall through signs and cobwebs
Top of doors should now play the opening sound
End Portal frame is now added to creative menu
Removed one of the duplicate iron bar recipes
Fixed recipes for mushroom soup and pumpkin pie
Grass and leaves are now rendered underwater
Villages are now placed more sparsely (the old ones should disappear when creating a new world)
You can now feed wolves correctly
Added nicer destroy particles to blocks
Giant mushrooms should drop mushrooms now (instead of Giant Mushroom blocks)
Top slab should not cause rendering issues anymore
v0.9.0 alpha build 5 is the fifth build version released for v0.9.0.

Loading textures in the background to avoid hiccups at runtime
Tall grass is not flammable anymore
Added a recipe for Emeralds
Compiled LevelDB with more optimizations
Somewhat faster torch placing
Improved (again) block breaking particles
Optimized rendering of particles
Flat worlds can now be customized by editing the options.txt file[3]

Fixed Multiplayer
Fixed a crash in Explosion
The sky doesn't become dark anymore when swimming/exploring shallow caves
Fixed water not creating obsidian when generated with the world
Fixed incorrect light updates
Fixed TNT not rebuilding graphics
Fixed TNT not exploding other TNT
Can now spawn Redwood trees from spruce sapling
Fixed black faces on fences, doors and trapdoors next to walls
v0.9.0 alpha build 6 is the sixth build version released for v0.9.0.
Lighting from torches is brighter and more Java-like

Fixed a crash when destroying a block under a rail
Chunks now always update when the sky light changes
Vines now work correctly
Drip particles no longer have a black outline
Made terrain rebuilding more stable under frequent updates (TNT, falling sand, etc)
Mooshrooms can breed
The status of the player is reset when it dies (e.g. on fire)
Close button on chests works again
Items are no longer placed in the [...] slot
Grass tiles now decay under other blocks
Crafting signs now yields 3 units
Fixed many artifacts on doors
End portal frame is now visible when held
v0.9.0 alpha build 7 is the seventh build version released for v0.9.0.

Preloading limited worlds to reduce stuttering
Made villages more common
Selecting the correct start tab of the Creative inventory
The Survival inventory now defaults to the Crafting screen when interacting with crafting tools
Removed the end portal frame with eye from the Creative inventory
Increased network protocol version (can't connect with build 6 or older)

Fixed another crash bug in the Furnace
The game doesn't spawn a huge number of mobs anymore
Fixed spawning outside of limited worlds' bounds
Fixed spawn location on clients
It is now possible to destroy a transparent block without hitting the block behind it
Ladders, torches etc. can now be placed close to (intersecting) the player
The furnace inventory should correctly refresh
Fixed duplicate join message on the server
Fixed rendering bugs in the Survival armor screen
v0.9.0 alpha build 8 is the eighth build version released for v0.9.0.

Faster texture loading (should not get stuck anymore)
The developers no longer write the player tag to level.dat
Enderman damage is now the same as PC

Fixed two crashes in furnaces
Fixed an infinite loop (the game would hang) when loading a world with a fully empty column
The player can now interact with all blocks again
Grass now correctly spreads to dirt blocks again
Immersive mode should now work correctly
Fixed wolves not remembering their sit state
Leaves don't turn to wood anymore
Furnaces now show the progress bar when moving items again
Now using the correct spawn location for old worlds
Mobs don't run at you anymore in Creative
Zombies and spiders now use the new AI
v0.9.0 alpha build 9 (RC1) is the ninth build version and first release candidate for v0.9.0.

Mob spawners now emit light
Creepers and Skeletons now use the old AI again
Tame and sit interact button for wolves
Crafting screen no longer switches to the next recipe when you can't make the current one

Crash with wolves
Crash when removing blocks under rails
Blocks placed where player was standing
Wrong spawn location
Entities are now more reliably saved
Crafting of unlimited number items
Missing smooth lighting on top snow and carpets
Wolfs moving around while sitting
Offspring was untamed in certain cases
Creepers floating above the ground
Wrong collar color on wolves
The interact button is now only "pressed" when released
Black borders on particles when destroying torches
v0.9.0 alpha build 10 (RC2) is the tenth build version and second release candidate for v0.9.0.

Way fewer melons in jungles
Made ladder collision box slightly thinner

Can now place things on top of fences and walls
Can now destroy blocks behind signs and torches
Fixed some issues with leaves
Mob spawners don't ignore torches anymore
Cacti can't be placed next to each other anymore
Leaves' and tall grass destroy particles are not gray anymore
Fixed a potential and very random crash
Fixed some situations where liquids could stop flowing
Fixed spawn position in multiplayer
Tabs in the Creative inventory don't have a small offset anymore
v0.9.0 alpha build 11 (RC3) is the eleventh build version and third release candidate for v0.9.0.

Blocks destroyed as a result of other blocks being destroyed (topsnow, grass, etc.) emit destruction particles too
Added jungle wood slab recipe
Sand does not fall anymore through wall signs
Added Hardened Clay recipe for furnaces
Added Stained Clay recipe to the Crafting Table

Added baked potato's name
Fixed black artifacts on Villagers
Fixed young mobs having the same hitbox as adults
Creepers can now be ignited again
Fixed black artifacts on particles from doors, torches, etc.
Fixed bed particles
Fixed explosions in multiplayer
Doors are now synchronized correctly in multiplayer
Fixed a pretty bad memory leak in multiplayer, on clients
v0.9.0 alpha build 12 (RC4) is the twelfth build version and fourth release candidate for v0.9.0. It is the final build version and final release candidate for this version.
Batched SetEntityMotion, EntityPos and HeadRotation packages together (down from 3000 packages per second to 150)

Crash with deleted chunks
A memory corruption
Issue on Android that didn't reuse graphics buffers correctly, caused weird triangles and holes
Crash when loading a world where the player was riding
Crash with exiting worlds while riding
Synchronization issues with multiple players in multiplayer
Entities was incorrectly added on the client
Multiple bugs with tile entities on clients
Spawn location on clients
Reseting spawn location would put players on roofs
Interact buttons now work in multiplayer
Placing rails was broken on clients (wrong direction)
Chests have been fixed for clients
"The Advanced Cave Culling Algorithm™, or, making Minecraft faster" , 31 August 2014.
"The Advanced Cave Culling Algorithm™ Part 2 - Traversing the graph" , 31 August 2014.
"Hey modders, what about sand flatworlds? Hint- this is a thing in the next build: 'game_flatworldlayers:[7, 12,12,12]'" – @_tomcc on Twitter, June 18, 2014
